clusters.title: Halloween house-party explodes into chaos in Perth
clusters.neutral_headline: Police Shut Down Out-of-Control Halloween Party in Perth

items.title: Halloween house-party explodes into chaos in Perth
items.standfirst: An out-of-control Halloween party in Perth's south-east was broken up by police after hundreds of teenagers turned up.
items.content: An out-of-control Halloween party in Perth's south-east was broken up by police after hundreds of teenagers turned up - many of them gatecrashers.Two officers were allegedly assaulted while dispersing the crowd at the Byford home last night, landing two party goers in the lock-up overnight.What started as a Halloween party soon turned more trick than treat when Linton Street North was flooded with more than 400 people.READ MORE: Woman charged with murder over death of baby in Perth's south "It was not the owner's fault at all," neighbour Jean told 9News."These kids appeared from nowhere and it was the owner that called the police because I saw him afterwards and he was very concerned."While many were simply there for spooky thrills, neighbours say a few poisoned apples were screaming, smashing bottles, jumping fences and even lunging at police."So the policeman at the side, he was wonderful, he dived on this big teenager, knocked him on the floor."Then all the other policemen dived on top. It was just like on television!"A 16-year-old girl was accused of punching one officer in the face, then kicking another in the knee.Randy Hill, 21, fronted court today, charged with disorderly behaviour, obstructing a public officer and drug possession.Some neighbours say at one point a stream of about 200 teenagers walked down the road to get to the party.They'd come from the recently opened Byford train station about a kilometre away.The same group left a trail of smashed bottles and broken fences when asked to leave.Residents and partiers picked up the pieces, with the street still littered with bottles, cans and discarded Halloween costumes.It was a night of thrills and spills that won't soon be forgotten. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

The party was in Perth's south-east.

clusters.title: 'Morons': Liam Gallagher blasts fan after first Oasis gig in Melbourne
clusters.neutral_headline: Liam Gallagher Reacts to Fan's Flare at Oasis Concert
bullet_summary: A flare let off by a crowd member at the first of three Melbourne Oasis concerts has angered the band's co-founder Liam Gallagher, sparking an expletive-laden post

items.title: 'Morons': Liam Gallagher blasts fan after first Oasis gig in Melbourne
items.standfirst: O asis singer Liam Gallagher has called out a fan who threw flares at the British band's first concert in Australia.
items.content: O asis singer Liam Gallagher has called out a fan who threw flares at the British band's first concert in Australia.The flare was thrown into the crowd at Marvel Stadium during hit song Champagne Supernova, with Liam saying "that's naughty, naughty, naughty," according to fans. Footage posted on social media shows flames erupting into the crowd. READ MORE: Calls for Andrew to face questions in the UK and US after being stripped of titles Gallagher later said on X " To the massive c--- who launched that flare into the crowd last night at the gig in Melbourne you are one seriopusly f----- up individual and you will get yours trust me."Fans on Reddit called it a "scumbag" act and called the people "morons"."Hope everyone was okay where it landed and no one got badly burnt," one fan said."They could have burnt some poor girls face. Hope they get arrested and banned from gigs," another said.In 2019 a fan at an Oasis concert in Sheffield in the UK was burned by a flare. Stacey Andrew told the BBC the flare fell down her top and set fire to her shirt and she feared she would be "scarred for life."Victoria Police said the incident has not been reported to them and there were no arrests.READ MORE: Trips to the doctor just got cheaper thanks to $7.9 billion overhaul Marvel Stadium told 9News no one was harmed, adding: "We'll leave the on record comments to Liam Gallagher's post." Earlier this year there were calls for extra security after a teenage boy was allegedly caught trying to smuggle weapons into Marvel Stadium during the Swans-Bombers AFL clash.Oasis has five shows across Melbourne and Sydney.The band will play two more shows in the Victorian capital tonight and on Tuesday. Oasis will then fly to Sydney for two shows at Accor Stadium, on Friday and next Saturday.
